definition: acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]

sentences.english: Culpeper recommends it as an antidote for poison.
sentences.chinese: 库帕尔认为它是一种解毒药。

sentences.english: This herb can act as an antidote against snakebite.
sentences.chinese: 这种药草可用作蛇咬的解毒药。

sentences.english: Do you have any antidote for a snakebite?
sentences.chinese: 你有治疗毒蛇咬伤的解毒药吗？

sentences.english: Is that antidote strong enough to expel the poison?
sentences.chinese: 这种解毒药有那么强，能驱散毒素吗？

sentences.english: An antidote against snake-bites, malaria, food poisoning.
sentences.chinese: 蛇咬，疟疾，食物中毒的解毒药。

sentences.english: But there is no effective medicine treat the aconitine poisoning.
sentences.chinese: 而临床治疗上尚无特效解毒药治疗乌头碱中毒。

sentences.english: Knowlege is the antidote to fear.
History is the best antidote to delusions of omnipotence and omniscience.
sentences.chinese: 历史是对于全能全知幻觉最好的解毒药。

sentences.english: This herb can act as an antidote against snakebite.
sentences.chinese: 这种药草可以用作被蛇咬后的解毒药。

definition: to detoxify/to relieve fever (in Chinese medicine)
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]
effective medicine for a specific condition/highly effective medicine
